website_summaries.verdict: The Optoma HD37 home entertainment projector shows occasional rainbow artifacts, but makes up for it with excellent color and some features you wouldn't expect for the price.
pros: Image quality is suitable for home theater use
cons: Shows rainbow artifacts, primarily in black and white film clips

customer_reviews.title: Likely best for a larger room
customer_reviews.text: My theater room is 12 feet across. As result the projector and the seating are in close proximity. I found the fan noise level and the dissipation heat level too high given my configuration. I was disappointed to have to return the projector as the picture was rich and vivid, plus the HD37 has loads of parameters for customizing the image. The other factor leading to the return was the power cord did not fit snugly into the projector. Even the most delicate of moves while I was optimizing the projector location caused the projector to shut down.
customer_reviews.author: agent5-0

customer_reviews.title: Was pleased with the picture
customer_reviews.text: Was pleased with the picture, however I had to have it serviced by Optoma after about 60 days of use due to dust particles penetrating inside the color wheel. It is currently on its way back to them. I don't know if this is a known issue or I just received a bad unit. Pretty bummed out.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Nash

customer_reviews.title: Incredible value for the Home Theater
customer_reviews.text: The Optoma HD37 is an awesome HT Projector. I purchased it just last week and have been thoroughly impressed with the brightness, color and even contrast projecting a 110in image on a off-white screen, with no tweaking at all. I have watched Cable News @ 720P and Movies in 1080P and they look fantastic. My primary TV is an 80in Sharp LCD and the image quality from the projector compares well with the TV's. I can't wait to install a 120in screen that drops over the TV for game/movie time!
customer_reviews.author: Ramachandra Srivatsa

customer_reviews.title: Crisp picture, perfect long throw; it's loud by itself (mine will be in a closet).
customer_reviews.text: The picture is crisp. The long throw was exactly what I need to put the projector in the closet 15' away from the screen. It has enough zoom, focus, and keystone correction for my 100" screen from 15' away. As you're watching a movie, the projector's noise will bleed into mostly unnoticed background noise, but with no other noise to wash it out, it's loud. You can find cheaper projectors for similar quality, but I needed the distance.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Burch

customer_reviews.title: Lamp stop working after less than 100 hours of use.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this projector in Nov. of 2015 because it was on sale, and we wanted to replace our old Optoma projector which was 12 years old. We started using the projector 6 months after we installed it. The picture quality was great and we were happy with our purchase. Last night my kids went to watch a movie and the lamp stopped working. The previous model lasted 12 YEARS. This one was used less than 100 hours and now they want me to pay 1/2 the cost for the lamp. I am so pissed and disappointed with this on every level. Maybe the Sale was because they knew they had a defective product. I do NOT recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good projector at a fair price with features we wanted.
customer_reviews.text: This is our first projector, but we love it. It is bright enough to work in all but the worst ambient light conditions. Picture is vivid and clear. Mounting on the ceiling was a snap with the universal mount we bought off Amazon. I would definitely recommend this projector to a friend. I like the optical zoom and lens shift adjustments, so you don't need to use Keystoning quite as much. Also worked well for the long-ish dimensions of our room.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Rosner

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: This projector is great. I have it around 16 feet away from the wall and I am getting around a 100" screen. It will go larger with the zoom. I really like the built in speaker but it sounds as you would expected from a speaker behind your head. Very bright picture. I don't have to close the blinds all the way to still get a good picture. I would recommend this projector.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Projector, Disappointing Lamp
customer_reviews.text: I love this projector. The Video is great, and the 3d is awesome. There is only 1 issue... I purchased this less than a year ago, and my lamp just blew. I called optoma and it is not covered under warranty. The price they gave me for a new lamp was $379. I really don't want to spend this kind of money every year. Even though I thought the projector was great, I am very disappointed in the lamp.

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good projector for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good projector for the money. The colors are excellent and it is bright enough to work decently well with my basement lights on. It gets a little washed out, but not bad. It looks amazing in a light controlled room though. I have a 150" screen, so it has to be like 22 feet from the screen. It still has plenty of power for this distance and size, I just notice a little loss of detail. Settings menus are average but the default settings are pretty decent, so I haven't had to change much to get a picture I like. Overall very good for the price.

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with it's quality
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding projector. I'm happy with it's quality, and I project it on a white wall. I can't wait to see the difference on a rigid screen. Easy to use, not too loud, and can be mounted or placed on a table. I have a small living room, and I have it on a small table about 9 feet in front of the wall. It projects an image at least 90" across, huge! Also, the lens shift is nice; the table it is sitting on is lower than the wall, so I am able to compensate. I got it during a sale, so only paid $750, so it is an amazing bargain!

product_meta.title: Optoma HD37 1080p 3D DLP Home Theater Projector
product_meta.description: Style:HD37With a Full HD 1080p image, the Optoma HD37 home cinema projector delivers magnificent quality video with bright, vivid highly-accurate colors using BrilliantColor technology. With a 2600 lumens, bright image and fifth generation DynamicBlack technology to generate a remarkable 20,000:1 contrast ratio, the HD37 produces visually stunning images with higher color accuracy and better tonal range for true-to-life colors. MHL (Mobile High-Definition Link) support allows Mobile Devices (smart phones, tablets) and Media Sticks to connect directly to the HD37 for playback of music, pictures and videos. Full 3D 1080p enables 3D high resolution viewing via DLP Sync 3D Glasses or RF 3D Glasses. The HD37 is the Premier Home Cinema Projector for watching movies and engaging in video games.
feature_bullets: Screen Size Range: 66-inches from 8 feet; 99-inches from 12 feet
Contrast Ratio: 20,000:1; Keystone Correction: Yes, Lens Shift: Yes
Warranty: 1-Year Limited Parts and Labor, 90-Days on Lamp
Inputs: Two HDMI (w/MHL), VGA-in, composite video, stereo audio-in, RCA stereo audio-in, stereo audio-out, 12V trigger, RS-232C, USB-A (power), mini-B

Use the USB-Power to power an HDMI dongle, such as Google Chromecast or the Optoma HDCast Pro wireless HDMI device. It eliminates the hassle of running extra HDMI cables or power adapters for the wireless HDMI device.
